website_summaries.verdict: Between their faithful recreation of the original Kanto region, streamlined gameplay, and lower difficulty, these games are a fantastic introduction to the world of Pokémon.
pros: Start with Eevee or Pikachu partner
Take favorite creatures with you via Pokémon Plus accessory
cons: Geared towards younger and brand-new players, this pair of games aren’t too challenging

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy if you are looking for any sort of challenge. You literally have to try to get a single pokemon on your team to faint. Why they haven't added difficulty levels to this game is beyond me. They targeted this game to some one in the 4-10 age bracket. Really disappointing as pokemon lover!
customer_reviews.author: Matt P.

customer_reviews.title: Not for old school Pokemon fans
customer_reviews.text: This game had the potential to be amazing. The graphics are fantastic as well as the backround/surroundings in the game...however the big downside is that you cannot battle wild pokemon and you cannot train. You really are not a Pokemon Trainer, more like a Pokemon Collector. Think of this game as Pokemon Go! for your living room. You just go around catching Pokemon with minimal challenge. The only battling you do is with trainers or gym leaders. This game could have been so much more if they just added the normal battling and training aspects. For a child this game would be more fun but for a long time Pokemon fan you will most likely be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Justyn Cousino

customer_reviews.title: No Pokemon battles
customer_reviews.text: Extremely dissatisfied - you cannot battle wild Pokemon. You can only catch wild Pokemon. I'm still shock about this they couldn't have made a more stupid decision even if they had tried. If you have play previous generations of Pokemon you will understand.
customer_reviews.author: JUNIOR

customer_reviews.title: I want to love it, but i'ts not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.text: The game is pretty cheep for a 60 dollar release, especially from Nintendo. The animations, the story, the recycling of ideas but dumbed down. THis game had a lot of potential, but the core experience is just a dumbed down pokemon yellow. I'm not even talking about the pokemon catching, I love the new system. I don't even mind the more lax nature of the game, I think the design choices that make the game more casual are great. But what's left over is just a retread of the old game with nothing to distinguish save the face lift. But it's not enough of a face lift to warrent the price.
customer_reviews.author: Star Zinico Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Ordered for Christmas
customer_reviews.text: Arrived with no problems. Just have to wait for Christmas now to give it to my daughter. Fingers crossed it’ll work!
customer_reviews.author: Annie Ribeau

customer_reviews.title: Good game. Bad Amazon.
customer_reviews.text: The game is exactly what I expected and what was described in all the videos that have been released. However I am becoming very displeased with amazon not giving me the booklets that are supposed to be IN THE GAMES. This is the second brand new game I've gotten from amazon that doesnt have the booklet in it. I dont understand why this is.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Great game for kids and casual gamers!
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent game overall. Great graphics, sound, and gameplay. Easy to pick up and play for kids and casual gamers. This game is a simplified and streamlined pokemon game, with a low learning curve and low difficulty. Don’t expect a classic pokemon experience, with lots of depth and difficulty from this game.
customer_reviews.author: Earl

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Love the game its a great redesign of Pokemon R/G/B/Y. Just HATE how @Amazon sent my copy to me. I collect the physical copies of games I like and the case is broken. They could of spent one extra F'ing dollar to send it in a cardboard box but they F'ing sent it in a paper bag.
customer_reviews.author: Daon

customer_reviews.title: Utter disappointment
customer_reviews.text: A third of my throws flew in the wrong direction, no matter how I tried to correct. Wasted so much cash on replacement pokeballs. Such a poorly designed mechanic. Get the 3ds games it you want a good pokemon experience, this was a waste. Don't bother. Not to mention the game with the box cracked and won't close and arrived 4 days late.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Schaap

customer_reviews.title: Great family fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is beautiful! I remember going to Blockbuster and buying Pokemon Red for my gameboy color, neon green of course. The pure nostalgia is awesome it itself. I play with my 4 year old daughter, so the wild encounters are awesome for us. She loves throwing Pokeballs. The dual battles make the game too easy though. For a long time fan, this game is awesome. Anyone who complains about no wild fights is a fool. How fun is running from 30 zubats? You can actually just evade them and run now.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: 5 Stars
customer_reviews.text: I'm a Pokemon veteran that has played every generational game from Red/Blue to Ultra Moon. I loved every second of this game! It's a nice, soft reboot for the series, as I thought Gen VII got too much away from the classic formula of Pokemon. My only complaint is the forced use of a single joy-con controller on TV mode. I really wanted to use either the Pro controller or two joy-cons in the comfort grip.
customer_reviews.author: KiryuDojima

customer_reviews.title: Meh could have been better
customer_reviews.text: Being a highly anticipated Pokeman game, this fell short for me. Most of the game is designed in the old hand-held Gameboy style playing, but just more 3D modern graphics. The only gameplay that is better viewing mode, is the battles. Forward facing and more details. But the rest of the game, exploring the map, towns, etc. is like a 2019 Gameboy game. I expected something better, like a "Zelda Breath of the Wild" but with Pokeman instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Am I missing something?
customer_reviews.text: It's cute, and it reminds me so much of my childhood to play the same locations and do nearly the same things as I remember doing as a kid. However, I don't like the new system where you have to catch pokemon nearly exclusively to get XP. It's horrible and dumb and has truly ruined this game for me. You don't get to battle wild pokemon, just throw balls at them in the Pokemon GO way. I just feel they tried too hard to make it different when I think a lot of fans would have been happy with a total remake of the game instead.
customer_reviews.author: Ericka

customer_reviews.title: Classic Pokémon but tacked on motion controls - great game but far from perfect
customer_reviews.text: A great, classic Pokémon remake. The updated graphics and especially music are really nice, mixed in with the game boy sound effects (except for your partner Pikachu/Evee). Game itself is a decent challenge, not too easy but not hard either. The new way of being able to see wild Pokémon instead of random encounters is brilliant and should be standard from now on. Only major downside is the annoying Pokémon GO like “wild” encounters. Motion controls don’t work 100% of the time, causing a lot of poke balls to go to waste. Also, no pro controller option is so, so baffling... Despite these sett backs, still a great game overall.
customer_reviews.author: Gidi

customer_reviews.title: Great Remake For Casual Players
customer_reviews.text: If you're looking for a relaxing Pokemon game with less of an experience grind and more focus on the story and capturing of Pokemon, then this is the game for you. Eevee is adorable and the game itself brought back many fond memories of the original Red and Blue version. However, the combat system has been replaced with Pokemon Go mechanics. You no longer battle Pokemon except with other trainers that you come across in the game. Instead, when you run into a wild Pokemon, you simply aim and throw your Pokeball at it in hopes of capturing it with more powerful Pokeballs eventually being available to capture higher level Pokemon.
customer_reviews.author: TBS

customer_reviews.title: A fun game
customer_reviews.text: Even as a fan of the more mainstream Pokemon games, this was much more fun than I expected it to be. I mainly got it for it's use with Pokemon Go, as I dislike motion control schemes like the Let's Go games have, but ended up really enjoying the game itself. The controls do take some getting used to, and the lack of support for the Pro controller does suck, but the game itself is fairly solid. It's perfect for someone's first foray into Pokemon games (or at least first foray into non-phone Pokemon games), while still being something that existing Pokemon fans would enjoy playing.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Hayes

customer_reviews.title: No Game Included
customer_reviews.text: If I could give this 0 stars I would. This isn’t the developers fault but it’s either Nintendo’s or Amazon’s fault for why when my girlfriend opened this up for Valentine’s Day it didn’t have the game in the case. How does that even happen? This was my first game I ever bought online and it will be my last. Thank you for the worker who slacked off and sent this case to the shelves with no game in it.
customer_reviews.author: Fingolfin

customer_reviews.title: Know what you're getting and you'll be fine
customer_reviews.text: A lot of people were disappointed with this title and after researching and reading up on what people didn't like - I wasn't disillusioned with the game once I ordered it. I did order it with a gift card so maybe that's why I like it so much, but I do like this game even though eevee's voice is a little grating at times. I much much much prefer that you can see wild pokemon and don't have to worry about attacking them to catch them - which a lot of people dislike so make sure you're aware of the changes. I know they were catering to their Pokemon Go audience, but I really enjoyed playing this anyways.
customer_reviews.author: ghoulgirl

customer_reviews.title: Okay.
customer_reviews.text: A little slow in comparison to previous Pokémon versions. Don’t like how you have to catch Pokémon. Or that you can’t battle wild Pokémon to level up your Pokémon. You have to either catch them or run. Annoying. Have a hard time getting into this game. And I love Pokémon.
customer_reviews.author: Denisef23

customer_reviews.title: Empty case
customer_reviews.text: Bought as a Christmas present. It was factory sealed but once it was opened there was no game inside. It was an empty case. Trying to return but Amazon's page keeps referring me to Nintendo. Not happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: I play Pokemon Go! and I need Meltan boxes, so I bought this game for my son who was eager to play it for nostalgia purposes. He found the game really disappointing lacking some of the better aspects of the earlier games. If you are willing to spend the money to get the Meltan boxes, be aware you have to beat 3 gyms before you can get there. I guess I will be learning how to play my son's Switch because he's too bored to play it.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Del Sesto

customer_reviews.title: Fun, low stress, Pokemon experience
customer_reviews.text: I'm playing this in the cooperative mode with a 5 year old. He's loving it as his first introduction to Pokemon games. For people who have played prior Pokemon games, this is not nearly as deep of an experience. If you understand the type of game before diving in, you'll set your expectations properly. It's definitely an intro/beginner type game. If you are looking at getting this for a younger child, highly recommend the official strategy guide. Not because it's needed to get through (again, it's a pretty easy game), but it's very detailed, super high quality, and legit endless entertainment for a young kid to go through the Pokedex and pictures and everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Flaherty

customer_reviews.title: GIVE IT A TRY!
customer_reviews.text: Okay so let's start off with this, it is absolutely a remake again but easier. When catching Pokemon it is something to get used to but once you got it down you're golden. I want people to stop complaining because this is a game made for KIDS so maybe gen oners won't like it although I have played since gen 1 I still love it. Nintendo did it's best to make this as similar as yellow. I think Nintendo did good to make it refreshing. People need to stop bashing this game it's marketed for kids!
customer_reviews.author: Alexis Verduzco

customer_reviews.title: Suggestions and more
customer_reviews.text: I wish it was longer gameplay. As a fan since Pokémon started, comparison to Pokémon yellow is very similar to this game with modern graphics except for the catching technique of Pokémon go style. I prefer to battle and weaken the Pokémon before capturing them. I know new game Pokémon sword and shield is bringing back the old school style. However I do wish they bring back the Pokémon appearing in the wild rather than random encounters. Capture them Pokémon go style but only after battling and weakening them. Bring back the capture ratio based on pokeball.
customer_reviews.author: Guardian

customer_reviews.title: Surpising to me
customer_reviews.text: I have never been a big Pokemon fan and in general ignor the whole thing, but my son wanted this game so I got it for him. Since we are at home all the time right now he does not have a lot of options for getting to play games with others except fot online play which isn't always possible, so he asked me to play with him. I was surprised how engaging and entertaining this game is. Now we play together at least once a week. I think it is a fun game overall and worth adding to your game collection.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Ann Bianchi

customer_reviews.title: It's a cute game.
customer_reviews.text: It reminds me of one of the older games, special edition Pokemon Pikachu Yellow. There are differences, but it takes from the story of that game. You catch Pokemon in a similar way you would with Pokemon go, but you still do battles with gyms and other trainers. I only see generation 1 Pokemon in the game, but one of the coolest features of this game to me, is that while your Eevee rides on your head, (or if you are thinking let's go Pikachu, your Pikachu rides on your shoulder,) you can also have ANY Pokemon of your choosing follow you outside of it's pokeball. If the Pokemon is really big you ride it! It's great!
customer_reviews.author: Miz

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money
customer_reviews.text: I honestly don't like this game AT ALL!! What happened to fighting the wild pokemon to weaken it to then catch it!?? All I do is throw the poke ball and catch it!! 😭😭 They took away all the excitement out of the game.... now to level i have to catch all sorts of weak pokemons and worst part is you CAN'T release them back into the wild!!?? What's going on?? they seriously took away the fun taking away the fights with the wild pokemon. They're just taking advantage of the love we fans have for the Franchise to make money....
customer_reviews.author: Nanita Ruiz

customer_reviews.title: Literally made for children under 12
customer_reviews.text: I'm 22, and I've been playing Pokemon since elementary school. Naturally, when I got a Switch I thought I had to have the newest Pokemon game. This was the easiest game I have ever played, ever. Pokemon games are not naturally known for their difficulty, yet this game made Pokemon Emerald look like Dark Souls in comparison. If you're a fan of Pokemon buying this for nostalgia, just don't do it. Pokemon Sword/Shield will give you a better sense of nostalgia. This game was meant as a Christmas/birthday present for your infant children.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Winters

customer_reviews.title: A must for Pokémon lovers
customer_reviews.text: If you look Pokémon this is a must buy a game for you! We ordered this for my daughter for her birthday and she couldn’t of been more excited for this she was more excited for this game than anything else she got for her birthday! The game place seems really smooth and really easy for kids to learn on it’s not hard for them to play also the graphics are really good on the game. But if you felt this review to be helpful please check this was helpful... Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Sherry&David

customer_reviews.title: Love the updated visuals
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely loved playing pokemon blue and yellow on my gameboy color back in the day, and i also got firered and leafgreen after they released. its obvious i would get lets go eevee. The game is very cute, the controls are easy to get in to, and i love how you can catch wild bulbasaur, squirtle, and charmander. The only negative is the minuscule exp from battle, i love the battling, but there is almost no reward for doing so. that being said, this game reminds me of my childhood and im looking forward to shiny hunting my favorite pokemon!
customer_reviews.author: James A.

customer_reviews.title: Empty box.  No game inside
customer_reviews.text: It is tough to write a review on something that did not show up in the box. Received a sealed in plastic game box with no game inside. Nice rip off of $64. Son was a little disappointed Christmas morning. Thanks.
customer_reviews.author: paul burke

customer_reviews.title: Half-cocked entry in a great series.
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'm a bit late to the party, but I'll make it short and sweet. This and the Pikachu equivalent are not the Pokemon games you want to get on the Switch. These are half-hearted phoned in cash grabs that are attempting to emulate the success of Pokemon Go. Trouble is, it's trying to emulate that success from your couch. Doesn't quite work. Missing a piece of the puzzle. Anyway, my ranch is over. Just avoid this one at all costs. Not even worth a rent.
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: I think I was sold a fake copy
customer_reviews.text: Received the game but not as advertised. The cover looks a little faded and almost like a copy rather than an original cover. The grading system on the cover is different. Don't know if it will work for a US Nintendo Switch or not. Regardless I did not receive the product as pictured. Will
customer_reviews.author: Clos The Clown

customer_reviews.title: Great addition to the series!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT Pokemon game. Everyone complained about the lack of random battles, but I find it incredibly refreshing. You can hunt Pokemon in the wild like a real Pokemon trainer, instead of having hundreds of random encounters that slow down the game. Did the fans REALLY want to encounter 400 Zubats in a cave? My only real complaint is that the regular Poke-Balls are horrible. They won't catch anything. I find myself often selling all mine and buying all Great / Ultra Balls. Also, this game is definitely the prettiest of the series. Great graphics. You can really see your Pokemon come to life!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: So sweet I got cavities.
customer_reviews.text: I played the original Pokemon Yellow back in the day, and gotta love the update. I can see why some people might not like the catching system and lack of wild battles, but it's fun just for the nostalgia and the pokemon! Plus Eevee is the cutest thing ever. If you're looking for an experience like the traditional pokemon games, this might not be what you're looking for, but if you're just a fan of pokemon and want to have a fun little romp in Kanto, then you'd probably enjoy this!
customer_reviews.author: Meghan A Van Zandt

customer_reviews.title: EEEVEEEEEE
customer_reviews.text: If you've ever played Pokemon Yellow or any first generation game, GIVE THIS A SHOT. It retains the same elements from the early gen1 games, but adds in new things, like newer moves, REMOVES THE DUMB HM'S, and wild encounters a lot less annoying (what with the short animations and not having to send out any Pokemon to battle it) If you enjoyed gen1 and want to revisit Kanto, buy it. If you're looking for that complex, competitive layer that was found in Sun and Moon, it won't be for you.
customer_reviews.author: SlimFreakinFast

customer_reviews.title: Not “traditional” but still fun
customer_reviews.text: As a Pokémon fan since childhood I can honestly say I loved this game through the view of Pokémon go. If you don’t like Pokémon go you probably won’t have a good time with this game but if you view it through the lens of not being a “traditional” Pokémon game it’s perfect. I liked the new spin on a classic game and the learning curve for the throwing was a little steep but once you figure it out it’s super fun
customer_reviews.author: Average Jill

customer_reviews.title: So cute! A great refresher for a longtime Pokemon fan
customer_reviews.text: I remember playing Gen 1 Pokemon games as a kid, so I have been a fan from the start! Eevee was a childhood favorite of mine, and who could resist this cutie? The catching mechanic was different, but I eventually got a feel for it. Many of the Pokemon that the game gives you along the way are pretty over-powered compared to the wild caught Pokemon, so the catching gimmick ended up a little lost on me, but would likely be fun for a first-time Pokemon trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie H

customer_reviews.title: Let's Go is the Perfect Pokemon Game
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of the Let's Go series and hope that they continue to add more games to the series. It's super cute, super-stylized, easy to play through but not lacking in story, it's a complete remaster of Pokemon Leaf Green and Fire Red, just without the extra islands. Would definitely recommend getting this for your friend or kid you want to introduce into the world of Pokemon in a way that won't overwhelm them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're only buying one, buy this one
customer_reviews.text: A great game, though surprisingly the experience is markedly different depending on which version you go with. Eevee is so much more powerful and versatile than Pikachu that Let's Go Eevee is practically the "Easy Mode" version while Let's Go Pikachu is closer to being a "Hard Mode". This difference is accentuated by the fact that Eevee's list of unique trainable moves added for the game dwarfs Pikachu's in both number and power of available options.
customer_reviews.author: Gamereviewer84

customer_reviews.title: Great game
customer_reviews.text: I started playing Pokemon when the original Gen 1 came out, and I've gone all the way through Ultra Sun/Moon. I've been around the block. I've shiny hunted and bred my share of pokemon. I really enjoy this game. I find it incredibly fun and refreshing. It doesn't have all of the mechanics that the more competitive games do, but it also adds features that those don't have. I am considering buying the Pikachu version as well.
customer_reviews.author: kmhsellers

customer_reviews.title: A Great Addition to the Switch Library
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Let's Go, Eevee! upon release late last year and sucked about 150 hours into the game before finally putting it down. This game is incredibly addicting and a beautiful wave of nostalgia for those of us who played the games in the late '90s and early 2000s. There are plenty of other reviews that dive more into the mechanics of the game and make a case for why you should purchase it. Listen to them, I did and don't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Mariana

customer_reviews.title: Good graphics,not 100% fun though
customer_reviews.text: It's a really well made game and came in good packaging and everything,I'm just halfway through and lost interest because it's really slow to level up by catching a ton of moving pokemon which makes me not have fun with it. I don't know how to properly rate this considering this is my own opinion on the game quality,I mean,it plays good,graphics are great,its just boring halfway through
customer_reviews.author: Amber D

customer_reviews.title: It's not a regular Pokemon game
customer_reviews.text: I liked the game but I wouldn't buy it if you're looking for the old-school red/blue experience. This is more of a bridge between PokemonGo and the regular games. There's gyms and trainers to battle, but it's less than challenging. You don't fight wild Pokemon at all, instead your team gains experience when you catch Pokemon using the Switch motion controls, which can become a bit repetitive (certain pokemon are worth more xp than others). Aside from simplified mechanics, the game itself is beautiful and if you enjoy PokemonGo you'll like this as well.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my 10YO. She is enjoying it. Get excited every time she encounter a pokemon and/or win a battle. She plays it on Handheld mode, so I can't comment on how it does dock with motion controller.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: Cute!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly this game is super cute! I love Pokemon, not a “hardcore” gamer, but as a 26 year old woman I still needed this game! The difficulty is not hard what so ever, it would be perfect for a younger kiddo. I still think it’s a cute game, & it’s basically about what I expected this game to be! Evee is a cutie pie & im having a nice time relaxing with this game after work 😀
customer_reviews.author: Mollypop

customer_reviews.title: Great game, lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: Based on the best generation of pokemon, this remake of the indigo league games with a pokemon Go feel to it is awesome and a ton of fun. The group leveling that takes place is similar to having the exp. share on your lead pokemon from some of the later games. This enables you to level weaker pokemon without having to put it in the front of your group and switch out every fight.
customer_reviews.author: Gage

customer_reviews.title: Pokémon at its finest!
customer_reviews.text: If you love Pokémon and you love Eevee, this is your game. The only different between the Eevee and Pikachu versions is your starter Pokémon. I love Eevee, so I will go with Eevee every time. In this game you get to travel through all the first gen Pokémon gyms and catch all the first gen pokemon. The story is really exciting, and really fun to play.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Fun for a couple of days until reality sets in....
customer_reviews.text: Nostalgia made this game fun for a couple of days and then it was all down hill from there. Once you get over the nostalgia hump it's just Pokemon Go again and you sit there for hours trying to catch shiny Pokemon.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin C

customer_reviews.title: Love it but cannot battle wild pokemon :(
customer_reviews.text: What I love and miss the most is pokemon yellow. I have pokemon yellow installed in my nintendo 3ds and love playing it. While I love pokemon: lets go, eevee and its homage to pokemon yellow, I cannot battle wild pokemon and how they get exp without the battle itself? annoying but I am hoping pokemon sword and shield I can battle wild pokemon
customer_reviews.author: Carlos Molina Jr.

customer_reviews.title: Super Cute! Great for Casual Players
customer_reviews.text: If you're new to the Pokemon franchise, or want a shot of pure nostalgia and cuteness to your system, you cannot go wrong here. This is an incredibly approachable entry to the franchise, retreading the ground covered in the very first game(s), with a lot of modern conveniences added in. Parents, if your young children love Pokemon but aren't quite ready for one of the main games in the series, give this a go instead!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For More Casual Players
customer_reviews.text: If you're a die hard, competitive Pokemon fan/player, you probably won't care for this game. However, as someone who as always enjoyed Pokemon in a much more casual and less serious way, this is a wonderful game. I love having an Eevee as my partner and the ability to have another Pokemon follow you as well. I hope these features continue in future installments.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan J.

customer_reviews.title: No game?
customer_reviews.text: Got the case new and sealed. Opened it and the game wasn’t even there? I’ll take this review down if the problems resolved but so far no good. I don’t really know how or why this happened when the game was purchased brand new.
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: Entertaining, as good as original yellow game
customer_reviews.text: Beat it within a few days... But I've also played every other Pokemon game almost. So yeah... It was pretty easy for me. Fun though. And there are some entertaining differences between the original yellow game. I won't spoil things. But I do give this game 5 stars and it doesn't ruin the originals like some remakes do. :)
customer_reviews.author: Krystal G.

customer_reviews.title: Fun
customer_reviews.text: The game is rea fun and I love that you can ride on the backs of certain pokemon, and others follow behind you. It's great if you want to relive the classic game, but it is lacking a feature that I wished was in it, and that is the Sevii Islands part of the game. The islands are not in it so the location of Moltres has changed. Overall, I enjoyed it and had nostalgia the entire time I played!
customer_reviews.author: Caitlyn E.

customer_reviews.title: It’s fun!
customer_reviews.text: I like the game a lot. I’ve only just started playing it so I haven’t figured it all out but so far so good. It’s user friendly so it is easy to get going and figure stuff out. Like you can ride onix in the game, and you defeat team rocket. I love how you can have it as a tablet and throwing poke balls is so easy. You just move areound and press a buttoon. You can feed Eevee and pet her. It’s incredibly cute.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Misleading and disappointing
customer_reviews.text: If you like Pokemon Go, this is the game for you. If you're like me, hoping this was a remake of the old Kanto region with updated graphics but the same challenging battles, look elsewhere. I was under the impression this was like every other pokemon game, instead I got a 50$ Pokemon Go game. You only catch wild pokemon and battle trainers. No weaken pokemon, no real challenge, boring dialogue. Overall, disappointing and misleading.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Average game at best.
customer_reviews.text: It’s an ok game overall , I think people are too generous with their reviews, a fair price would’ve been $29 , the kids played it for maybe 4 hours total if that . Very guided story and not much freedom to the story line.
customer_reviews.author: Z Swaidan

customer_reviews.title: A lot of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the game to relive and revisit the nostalgia knowing this wasn’t going to be *the* “mainline” game a lot of people were looking for. The catching mechanics and having the Pokémon roaming freely in the wild really made me feel like a trainer and brought a nice change of pace versus the wild encounters like the earlier games. Overall, it’s been a blast and the graphics are lovely!
customer_reviews.author: Shurrie

customer_reviews.title: A great game
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the game because it was different than most Pokemon games. The story was really great because you got to see a lot of familiar faces from the original Pokémon red/blue/green games, and from the newer games too. The one thing that threw me off thought was the fact that you couldn’t battle Pokemon you wanted to catch, I didn’t know it was like Pokémon go where you just catch the Pokémon. Other than that, it was a great game.
customer_reviews.author: PN

customer_reviews.title: Boring
customer_reviews.text: I thought it was kinda boring. The graphics were really simple as well. I returned it because I thought it was not worth the cost.
customer_reviews.author: S&KGardner

customer_reviews.title: Very unhappy about the pokemon go integration.
customer_reviews.text: The game itself is incredibly well made. The safari zone has been turned into a warp zone that you can use to transfer pokemon from pokemon go, which i was not happy about.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Dernier

customer_reviews.title: Very toddler friendly game!
customer_reviews.text: I play this game with my toddler. I don’t think it was intended, but great game for a toddler. He can be the support character, his character is movable with his own controller and he can catch Pokémon or battle with his own Pokémon when those situations come up- but my character is the only one that can actually move us, trigger battles or game content.
customer_reviews.author: Dustin Russell

customer_reviews.title: Let's Go, Eevee
customer_reviews.text: I preordered the Let's Go, Eevee. I was really expecting to be disappointed in the game. I started it with no expectations. I have played for about 10 hours now and I have to say that I am really enjoying this game. The only thing I dislike is not being able to actually battle wild Pokemon, but that hasn't stopped my enjoyment. I'm glad I gave this game a try.
customer_reviews.author: Doris

customer_reviews.title: Fun game!
customer_reviews.text: If came yesterday and I can’t stop playing it! As with a lot of Nintendo’s games, they are made for everybody (including children). If you are looking for difficult then this isn’t the game for you. If you are looking for a fun game and love Pokémon then this is great. I have no complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Pokemon Brown
customer_reviews.text: It’s a more streamline version of the original games. It’s a boring bland version of blue that sucks all the sense of adventure and exploration the original had. Your handed everything. Instead of having to find the gold teeth it’s handed to you. Instead of having instead of a safari zone we have Pokémon go, eevee is cute but it isn’t enough to save the game.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Let’s Go.
customer_reviews.text: A great blast of nostalgia and a mix of modern day tech. It’s great to reintroduce dose the original story to the newer generation. Although the concept of catching them isn’t what I remember, I suppose with how people are these days, it couldn’t be helped.
customer_reviews.author: sgtbluefire

customer_reviews.title: red and blue meet pokemon go
customer_reviews.text: i was kinda sad when people where like it nothing like red or blue and for the most part it is just not the wild pokemon thats is like pokemon go. i just dont like that when you disco a controller for catching you have to no choice throw it like a poke ball but it makes sense why but you can play most of it one handed for for catching i always had to reconnect the controller for catching
customer_reviews.author: david

customer_reviews.title: First game I played on switch
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't put it down. I love how it mixed old pokemon from gameboy with new from pokemon go. Throwing the ball and using the controller is a blast I love that there are so many different ways to play and my kid can join in the game and feel part of it without messing up my game at all! Love it so much.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Cherrybone

customer_reviews.title: Game is fine. Seller is bad.
customer_reviews.text: Game works fine, and I pretty much enjoy it. Only thing I dislike is that the case is all dirty. Sticker residue, and dirt are all over the base. Luckily the game card itself is fine. I wouldn't buy from this seller again. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AvidHerbalist

customer_reviews.title: Classic Game reimagined
customer_reviews.text: Like: nostalgic feeling when running through the old cities Dislike: All in all it feels like the same game as Pokemon yellow with revamped graphics and a few new features. Overall: Fun for a day or two but eventually I craved a new story and moved away from it to play other games.
customer_reviews.author: Kody

customer_reviews.title: Game Missing From Box!!!
customer_reviews.text: I was soooo excited because I bought my switch and this game at the same time. It was a splurge on myself, because I usually take care of everyone else first. Sadly when I opened my Let's Go Eevee game box it was empty!! I started a return and labeled it as missing... I hope I dont end up getting double charged for their mistake... I will update once I hear more
customer_reviews.author: Brianne

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: This review will be from my 10 year old. He was watching something on youtube and was encouraged to leave reveiws 🤣. So he wants to reveiw his birthday present. Lets Go Eevee is awesome. Its so awesome that my mom can send me her pokemon from pokemon go. I love my switch. And everything pokemon. Awesomeblue
customer_reviews.author: danielle

customer_reviews.title: One happy little girl
customer_reviews.text: I can't speak to the specifics on this game because it was for my 9nyear old girl but we were at a box store and it was $59.99, I told her that was to much and I looked on Amazon and it was $39.99. This made dad happy and little girl happy. She has been enjoying the game sense delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Everything was included and appears good quality too!
customer_reviews.text: We just receive our box of treasures! Everything is in there. I had to refer to the posting to check it was all there since some parts are small and/or inside the case. Super happy to use all this. I will say from the posting I wasn't sure if the case was going to be like a sleeve style or if it could hold games. Case Description: Neoprene type outer with a fairly rigid construction, felt like inner lined with bungee type strap to hold switch in place, 10-Game holder pockets, mesh pocket for cords and etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lots of fun!
customer_reviews.text: I'm having so much fun with this game! I love that you can dress up both yourself and eevee, you can definitely still name her, and you can have other pokemon follow you around or be ridden as well. Alolan forms can be transferred from Pokemon GO, as well as Meltan and Melmetal.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Feaster

customer_reviews.title: Easy but fun
customer_reviews.text: For any old school pokemon fan this hits home in all the right places. No there is no wild battles but I think it is a very charming game in it's own right. My kids love it and that is who I mainly got the game for so that is all that matters. I have been enjoying the game as well.
customer_reviews.author: CarnivorousRose

customer_reviews.title: What’s old is new
customer_reviews.text: The amazing gameplay of old is revamped and graphics have been overhauled, but under that fresh paint is all the Pokémon goodness your inner child can take. Good for newer poke-trainers and seasoned champions, everyone will find something to love. My own favorite new feature is the ability to see Pokémon in the world without random battles, a feature I truly hope they keep.
customer_reviews.author: stuffydoll

customer_reviews.title: Cute for whole fam
customer_reviews.text: Super cute for the whole family. Only complaint is that it doesn't allow to make separate characters, so be sure to make 1 avatar for everyone to use. My 4 and 5 year old join in and love catching pokemon. I haven't been able to connect it with pokemon go.
customer_reviews.author: KelseyinAZ

customer_reviews.title: This game has battles but it focuses on catching them all
customer_reviews.text: This is the best game to get if you are trying to shiny hunt Kanto pokemon. You can even use Pokemon Go (once you get to Fuchsia Town) and Pokemon Home to complete the Pokedex before even beating the Elite Four to get the shiny charm. As you can tell from my review that I lowkey enjoyed the game lol.
customer_reviews.author: Dashawn Hosea

customer_reviews.title: Different but still good!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to play as an adult. While I like it but there are changes that were made that took me a while to get used to. And those changes weren’t explained well enough to make sense at first. Still a very good game but it’ll take some time to get used to it.
customer_reviews.author: Grace W

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.text: Despite the negative reviews my. daughter, a huge Pokémon fan, loves this game. She said you just have to accept it for what is is. Maybe she is more forgiving than other fans. But she plays for hours on her switch.
customer_reviews.author: Average Joe

customer_reviews.title: Love this game, needs more post-game
customer_reviews.text: This game brings me back to when I used to play red and blue and yellow. Love having Pokemon follow me, and I especially love riding Pokemon. I only wish the post-game was better. I don't care for the master trainers. If the only problem with a game is that you need more if it, must be a good game right?
customer_reviews.author: Ryan W.

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: really poor quality with the most stupid catch system I have ever experienced.
customer_reviews.author: mingkai ji

customer_reviews.title: Great game for pokemon nostalgia
customer_reviews.text: After 3 attempts I finally got it because the delivery people never made a return trip to bring it to me in time for my daughter's birthday which was a huge disappointment. Nonetheless she was happy to finally get it
customer_reviews.author: Marcus Tuggles

customer_reviews.title: What else do you expect from Nintendo?
customer_reviews.text: It's a pokemon game; Nintendo has never made a bad pokemon game. Another phenomenal product from the pokemon company. :)
customer_reviews.author: Justin D.

customer_reviews.title: Gotcha have that Eevee
customer_reviews.text: In love with Eevee as much as I am!! Then you need need need to buy this Game ! It’s the about the same game play as the originals but so much better because you have your own personal eevee companion and a Pokémon that follows you. Gotcha Pokemon catching simulations has this game on point !!
customer_reviews.author: NekoSunshine

customer_reviews.title: Fun and Innovative!
customer_reviews.text: I was extremely impressed with a lot of the bold changes they did with the switch remake. Believe it or not, I ended up enjoying catching/training my Pokemon than battling. The catching system is addictive to score high points on especially when using both sticks
customer_reviews.author: Th3G3ntl3man

customer_reviews.title: Fun game
customer_reviews.text: My sister loves the game, you can see the pokemon in the grass so you can avoid them if you want. You also dont fight wild pokemon, you just catch them but there are still trainer and gym battles like normal. Its a mix between the regular pokemon games and pokemon go. Its a lot of fun with the pokeball as well!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Pirkle

customer_reviews.title: Pokemon  !
customer_reviews.text: The thing about giving in to temptation is it will take you farther than you ever wanted to go, it cost you more than you ever intended to pay, Keeps you longer than you ever intended to stay. :~PB
customer_reviews.author: ; ~ PB

customer_reviews.title: Dying From All the Cuteness!!!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this title, even though it’s not quite the same as some of the old games. Catching is quite different. More like Pokémon GO, or Safari Zone. A nice remake of the red-blue-yellow trilogy. Taking so many screenshots because Eevee is just so damn cute! Please note: Eevee cannot be evolved. But who would want to???
customer_reviews.author: Angelique

customer_reviews.title: Pokémon follow you, must I say more?
customer_reviews.text: Great introductory Pokémon game! I have been an avid Pokémon player since the original Red/Blue/Yellow. This game is entirely focused on new audiences and for us veteran players, it feels like a nice trip down memory lane... but with an easier chance at shiny Pokémon!!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: A new game experience to a nostalgic map
customer_reviews.text: Great Pokémon game! The dynamics are different from when we were kids but it has been very fun for me and my kids! I love not having to wander aimlessly in grass anymore honestly I know some reviews say it’s too easy or they don’t like it but it’s still a very fun game.
customer_reviews.author: H. Sisson

customer_reviews.title: Newer version of original Red & Blue
customer_reviews.text: My 7 and 8 year old ADORE Pokemon. And my husband and I love how it's a simpler, shorter version of the original Red and Blue versions. Plenty of nostalgia!!! The kids love catching and trading all the pokemon they catch with each other Keep in mind, instead of fighting pokemon, you get XP by catching them (like Pokemon Go).
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Game is ok. Bought for the wrong reasons.
customer_reviews.text: I had already bought lets go Pikachu and in my own opinion both games are a little over hyped and like most switch game over priced. Bought this version just for the Gmax Eevee on pokemon sword and shield in hopes I could create a full 6iv eevolution team (Didn't do enough research), unfortunately being a Gmax like Pikachu it is unable to evolve
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Virgilio

customer_reviews.title: Not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I thought this game would be a remake of Pokemon Red or Blue from my Gameboy days and it is for the most part, however there is no battling outside of Gym battles which is unfortunate as I am the type of player who collects every pokemon to complete their dex and then battles any extras i come across to power up my Pokemon. IF you get this game, understand its not a proper Pokemon game like Sword and Shield. Its more a pokeball tossing simulator.
customer_reviews.author: joseph m. polk

customer_reviews.title: Package vs snow sucks
customer_reviews.text: So nothing bad about the game, the delivery guy left my package in a pile of snow instead of putting it in my mailbox (which is kinda out there and big.) So by the time I got off work and dug the package outta the snow... the game was unable to play on my switch. Lesson of the story ether live in a warm environment or buy on the online store. (Or have a smart delivery person.)
customer_reviews.author: Krista gayle smith

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy online
customer_reviews.text: Cartridge was damaged, my switch had difficulty reading the card, until now it doesn’t even read it at all. Do NOT buy this if you want your moneys worth. Pick it up in store.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Having fun but way too easy!
customer_reviews.text: I'm enjoying this game but it is just way too easy.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Grooves

customer_reviews.title: Great, but...
customer_reviews.text: I have loved Pokemon since I had Pokemon Red for Gameboy. This new game is very cute and great, except ONE thing I can't wrap my head around. You can't battle Pokemon anymore?? Whaaaat? You only have the option to catch them or run away. I thought maybe I was doing something wrong at first.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Pokemon: Let's Go, Eevee!
product_meta.description:
Platform:Nintendo Switch| Edition:Let's Go, Eevee!

Take a Pokémon journey to the Kanto region with your steadfast partner, Eevee! Become the best Pokémon Trainer as you battle other Trainers, Gym Leaders, and the sinister Team Rocket. Catch Pokémon in the wild using a gentle throwing motion with either a Joy-Con controller or a Poké Ball Plus accessory, which will light up, vibrate, and make sounds to bring your adventure to life. You can also use button controls in Handheld Mode. Share your adventure with family or friends using a second Joy-Con or Poké Ball Plus (sold separately). You can even connect to the Pokémon GO app* using a compatible smartphone to bring over Pokémon originally discovered in the Kanto region!

Explore the vibrant region of Kanto—home to beloved characters like Brock, Misty, and the nefarious trio Jessie, James, and Meowth! Throughout the story, your bond with your partner Pokémon grows stronger as you care for it and travel together. See the world in style by customizing Eevee and your Trainer with a selection of outfits. True-to-size wild Pokémon roam around in the game—catch them like a real Pokémon Trainer by using timing and a well-placed Poké Ball. Battle and trade with other players who own the game via local wireless or online**. Go on a stroll with your favorite Pokémon in your Poké Ball Plus to level them up, and to receive in-game rewards after returning them to the game.

*Using as a Pokémon GO Plus requires installation of the Pokémon GO application on a compatible smartphone.

Game, system and Poké Ball Plus sold separately. *Pokémon GO application, compatible smartphone and persistent Internet access required. Data charges may apply. **Nintendo Switch Online membership (sold separately) and Nintendo Account required for online play. Not available in all countries. Internet access required for online features. Terms apply. ***Using as a Pokémon GO Plus requires installation of the Pokémon GO application on a compatible smartphone.
feature_bullets: Don the role of a Pokémon Trainer as you travel through Kanto
Discover a new species of Pokémon with the Pokémon Lets Go series
Catch Pokémon in the wild using a gentle throwing motion with either a Joy-Con controller or a Poké Ball Plus accessory, which will light up, vibrate, and make sounds to bring your adventure to life
See the world in style by customizing Pikachu and your Trainer with a selection of outfits
Connect to Pokémon GO* to transfer caught Kanto-region Pokémon, including Alolan and Shiny forms, as well as the newly discovered Pokémon, Meltan, from that game to this one

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,467 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
